articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in C# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 9th in C# (Shape: E)

## Overview
This chord is a C#9 (C# dominant 9th) played in the shape of an E chord. It consists of the notes C# (the root), E# (third), G# (fifth), B# (seventh), and D# (ninth).

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)
- D# (Major 9th)

## Genre and Flavor
The C#9 chord, played in an E shape, is commonly used in Jazz, R&B, and Funk music genres. It adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to compositions, creating a rich, colorful sound with its extended harmony.

## Songs
Here are 3 songs that use the C#9 chord:
1. *"Feeling Good"* by Nina Simone
2. *“I Wish”* by Stevie Wonder
3. *“Sir Duke”* by Stevie Wonder
